content: possum bag holder materials bulky/super bulky yarn ● pink nose & ears ● grey body ● beige face tail legs ● white toes ● black ears 8mm needles dpns can also use circular for body buttons or toy eyes for eyes optional instructions nose & snout in pink cast on 3 work i-cord 3 row switch to beige knit around face kfb k2 4 sts kfb k3 5 sts kfb k4 6 sts kfb around 12 sts head *kfb k1* 6 times around 18 sts *kfb k2* 6 times around 24 sts *kfb k3* 6 times around 30 sts *kfb k4* 6 times around 36 sts *kfb k2* 12 times around 48 sts knit around until head is about 2 5 long or desired length body switch to grey then knit about 6 5 make pouch k30 bo12 k6 k30 co12 using cable cast on k6 knit about 3 more inches butt & tail *k4 k2tog* around 40 sts *k3 k2tog* around 32 sts *k2 k2tog* around 24 sts k2tog around 12 sts switch to beige then k2tog around 6 sts work 6 st i-cord about 12 or however long you wish cut yarn and pull through sts sew end of tail 3-4 down to create a loop for hanging if desired ears make 2 co 5 in pink and 8 in black row 1 3 & 5 purl across using black for black sts and pink for pink sts row 2 knit across using black for black sts and pink for pink sts row 4 in pink k1 cdd central double decrease k1 then in black k1 k2tog k2 k2tog k1 row 6 in pink cdd and cut pink then in black k1 k2tog twice k1 row 7 purl across in black 5 sts row 8 k2tog k1 k2tog bobble in black cut yarn leaving enough length to seam fold ear and sew closed then whipstitch ears to body at beige to grey color transition feet make 4 co 16 sts in beige row 1 3 & 5 purl across row 2 *k1 k2tog k2 k2tog k1* twice 12 sts row 4 *k1 k2tog twice k1* twice 8 sts row 6 k2tog across 4 sts row 7 change to white for toes kfb kfbf knit in front and back and front again twice kfb 10 sts work each pair of sts in i-cord for 3 row to create 5 white toes sew closed then whipstitch feet to body
